Line 5: Line 5:
== Career ==
== Career ==
â
In 2004, Waugh was hired by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] as a founding member of [[Canonical Ltd]] and the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu project]], where he worked in [[business development]]. At [[OSCON]] in 2005, Waugh won "Best Evangelist" in the [[Google]]-[[O'Reilly]] Open Source Awards for his evangelism of Ubuntu and GNOME.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=osdir.com|url=http://www.osdir.com/Article6677.phtml|title=Awarded: $25G in Google-O'Reilly Open Source Awards|date=2005-08-02|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Google]]|url=http://code.google.com/opensource/osa-hall-of-fame.html|title=Google-O'Reilly Open Source Awards - Hall of Fame|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref> He announced his resignation from Canonical in [[July]] [[2006]] in order to focus more fully on his work in the GNOME project.<ref>{{cite web|last=Waugh|first=Jeff|title=Swimming upstream|url=http://bethesignal.org/blog/2006/07/15/swimming-upstream/|date=2006-07-15|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref>
+
In 2004, Waugh was hired by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] as a founding member of [[Canonical Ltd]] and the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu project]], where he worked in [[business development]]. At [[OSCON]] in 2005, Waugh won "Best Evangelist" in the [[Google]]-[[O'Reilly]] Open Source Awards for his evangelism of Ubuntu and GNOME.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=osdir.com|url=http://www.osdir.com/Article6677.phtml|title=Awarded: $25G in Google-O'Reilly Open Source Awards|date=2005-08-02|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Google]]|url=http://code.google.com/opensource/osa-hall-of-fame.html|title=Google-O'Reilly Open Source Awards - Hall of Fame|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref> He announced his resignation from Canonical in [[July]] [[2006]] in order to focus more fully on his work in the GNOME project.<ref>{{cite web|last=Waugh|first=Jeff|title=Swimming upstream|url=http://bethesignal.org/blog/2006/07/15/swimming-upstream/|date=2006-07-15|accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref>
[[As of 2007]] Waugh and his wife are co-directors of Waugh Partners, an Australian Open Source consultancy launched in 2006.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.computerworld.com.au/index.php/id;765011692|title=Waugh Partners to open up IT industry|date=2006-11-23|accessdate=2008-04-27|last=Gedda|first=Rodney|publisher=Computerworld}}</ref>
[[As of 2007]] Waugh and his wife are co-directors of Waugh Partners, an Australian Open Source consultancy launched in 2006.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.computerworld.com.au/index.php/id;765011692|title=Waugh Partners to open up IT industry|date=2006-11-23|accessdate=2008-04-27|last=Gedda|first=Rodney|publisher=Computerworld}}</ref>
